description: In this lesson you will learn about patient vital signs, and why they are critical for monitoring patient health. In addition, you will learn how to read patient vitals within the SIMVANA operating room.
In this lesson you will learn about how a patient’s heart rate is measured in the operating room, and how to interpret displayed heart rate values.
In this lesson you will learn how oxygen saturation and blood pressure is measured in the operating room. You will also learn how to identify safe ranges for these vitals.
In this lesson, you will learn how to begin preparing a patient for surgery with pre-oxygenation.
In this final challenge, you will be required to begin preparing a patient for surgery by connecting vital sensors and pre-oxygenating the patient.
In this lesson, you will learn about the different drugs in the medicine cart and how the drugs can affect the patient.
In this lesson, you will learn how to administer drugs to the patient intravenously.
In this lesson you will learn how to assess the patients level of consciousness in a quick and noninvasive manner.
In this lesson you will learn how to insert a Supraglottic Airway Tube.
In this challenge, you will complete a basic supraglottic airway induction on the patient. You will need to use all the skills taught in the Intro and Intermediate courses to complete this challenge.
Learn the importance of the CO2 absorber in the anesthesia machine.
Learn how to recognize an exhausted CO2 absorber.
Learn how an exhausted CO2 absorber can increase rebreathed CO2.
Learn how to properly replace a CO2 absorber.
Learn how to manage rebreathed CO2 when no CO2 absorber replacement is available.
Can you correctly resolve a patient's increasing CO2 level?
Learn what the backup oxygen cylinder is and where to find it on the anesthesia machine.
Understand the function of the hanger yoke assembly.
Learn how to open the Spare Oxygen Cylinder
Learn how to open the Auxiliary Oxygen Cylinder
Learn the importance of the Pin Index Safety System.
Learn how to estimate the time remaining in an oxygen cylinder based on its pressure and the O2 flow rate.
Can you identify which cylinder needs to be replaced?
Learn what happens when the master power switch is toggled on the anesthesia machine.
Learn about the unique properties of hospital power wall outlets.
Learn about the proper use of auxiliary outlets on the anesthesia machine.
Learn how the battery backup in an anesthesia machine functions during power outages.
Learn how the main circuit breaker controls power flow to the anesthesia machine.
Learn how auxiliary circuit breakers control power to outlets on the anesthesia machine.
Learn how the Line Isolation Monitor operates and increases patient safety.
Can you resolve the electrical issues on the anesthesia machine?
Learn the U.S. standardized color coding of pipeline gas connectors.
Learn the purpose of the Diameter Index Safety System.
Learn how to operate a pipeline gas quick connect fitting.
Learn how to read the pipeline pressure gauges on the anesthesia machine.
Learn how to properly identify a loss of pressure from a pipeline gas source.
Learn how to manage a pipeline pressure loss.
Can you properly manage a pipeline pressure loss?
Use the skills learned in this module to resolve a variety of issues on the anesthesia machine.
Learn the basics of the circle system.
Learn how the circle system provides unidirectional flow of gas.
Learn what the inspiratory and expiratory limbs are, and where to find them on the anesthesia circuit.
Learn what the inspiratory and expiratory valves are, and where to find them on the anesthesia machine.
Learn what the adjustable pressure limiting valve is, and where to find it on the anesthesia machine.
Learn what the breathing bag is and where to find it on the anesthesia machine.
Learn what the y-piece is as well as common pitfalls associated with it.
Can you identify and solve issues with the anesthesia circuit?
Learn about the flowmeter dials, and where they are located on the anesthesia machine.
Correctly identify the FiO2 delivered by the Air flowmeter.
Learn what makes the oxygen flowmeter dial unique, and where to find it on the anesthesia machine.
Correctly identify and operate the nitrous oxide dial and recognize how the proportioning system works.
Learn why the fail-safe valve is important, and verify that it is operating correctly.
Learn what the auxiliary common gas outlet is, and where it is located on the anesthesia machine.
Learn what the oxygen flush valve does, and some of the hazards it can introduce during anesthesia.
Learn how to estimate and set the FiO2 using the fresh gas flow rate.
Can you resolve issues with the anesthesia machine and deliver the proper gas mixture to the anesthesia circuit?
Learn what the scavenging system is, and where it's located on the anesthesia machine.
Recognize the characteristics of different types of scavengers.
Learn how to properly adjust the scavenging system.
Your scavenging system has two critical problems that you must identify and correct.
Learn what a variable bypass vaporizer is.
Learn how to correctly operate the sevoflurane vaporizer.
Learn how to correctly operate the desflurane vaporizer.
Learn how the vaporizer selector lock mechanism works on the anesthesia machine.
Learn how to identify and fix a loose vaporizer refill cap.
Learn how to refill a vaporizer with liquid anesthetic.
Can you correctly configure the machine to deliver an inhaled anesthetic?
Can you safely deliver an inhaled anesthetic to the patient?
Learn the importance of managing alarm settings on the patient monitor.
Learn how to change alarm settings on a patient monitor.
Can you properly set the patient monitor alarms to specific values in this mastery challenge?

cardTop: Intro to the Low Pressure Leak Test
description: Learn about the low pressure leak test bulb and it's use in checking for leaks in the anesthesia machine.

cardTop: Checking the Leak Test Bulb Integrity
description: Learn how to evaluate the integrity of the leak test bulb.

cardTop: Performing the Low Pressure Leak Test
description: Walk through the steps required to perform a low pressure leak test.
Can you properly perform a low pressure leak test?
Verify the presence of all required patient monitors.
Learn how to verify that the suction regulator is operating correctly.
Can you identify what's wrong with the patient monitors and manual resuscitator?
Learn where to find the oxygen sensor on the anesthesia machine.

cardTop: Calibrating the O2 Sensor to 21% Oxygen
description: Learn how to correctly calibrate the oxygen sensor to 21% oxygen.

cardTop: Calibrating the O2 Sensor to 100% Oxygen
description: Learn how to correctly calibrate the oxygen sensor with 100% oxygen.
Can you correctly calibrate the oxygen sensor on the anesthesia machine?

cardTop: Intro to the Positive Pressure Check
description: Correctly identify the components used in a positive pressure check.
Learn the steps required to perform a positive pressure check.
Can you correctly perform a positive pressure check?
Learn how to check the ventilation system and perform a valve check.
Can you complete a ventilation system & valve check?
Use the skills learned in this module to complete tests on the anesthesia machine.
Correctly identify the blood:gas solubility and MAC of desflurane.
Recognize how desflurane affects the systemic vascular resistance when the concentration is increased slowly.
Recognize how desflurane affects the patient's cardiovascular status when the concentration is increased rapidly.
Learn how to identify the potential airway effects of desflurane administration.
Learn how to identify the cerebrovascular effects of desflurane.
Learn how to identify the neuromuscular effects of desflurane.
Can you adjust the administration of desflurane to better suit the patient's history?
Learn what Mean Alveolar Concentration is.
Identify the significance and values for 1.3 MAC and MAC-BAR.
Learn what factors affect mean alveolar concentration.
Can you properly adjust the inhaled anesthetic to an appropriate mean alveolar concentration?
Identify the advantages and risks associated with nitrous oxide.
Identify cardiovascular effects of nitrous oxide.
Identify cerebrovascular effects of nitrous oxide.
Identify renal effects of nitrous oxide.
Identify the cause of diffusion hypoxia and how to prevent it from occurring.
Can you adjust the flowmeter settings appropriately for emergence?
Identify the blood:gas solubility and MAC of sevoflurane.
Identify cardiovascular effects of sevoflurane administration.
Identify respiratory effects of sevoflurane.
Identify cerebrovascular effects of sevoflurane.
Identify the neuromuscular effects of sevoflurane.
Identify the effect of sevoflurane on the renovascular system.
Identify the effect of sevoflurane on the hepatic system.
Can you recognize how sevoflurane affects physiological parameters and use the information to adjust your anesthetic to suit surgical conditions?
Learn the basics of Inspired Concentration (FI).
Learn what factors affect the speed at which the inspired concentration of an anesthetic approaches the vaporizer dial setting.
Learn the basics of Alveolar Concentration (FA).
Learn how FA and Fi affect the speed of induction.
Learn about the relationship between the blood:gas partition coefficient of an inhaled anesthetic and its onset of action.
Learn how anesthetic is distributed to the major tissue groups of a patient.
Differentiate between the relative rates at which anesthetic accumulates in tissue groups.
Learn what overpressurization is and how to use it to alter the speed at which FA approaches FI.
Learn about alveolar ventilation and how to manipulate it to alter the speed at which FA approaches FI.
Can you configure the machine to increase the rate of induction?
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous ephedrine.
Your objective is to correct a patient's hemodynamic status using intravenous ephedrine.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous esmolol.
Your objective is to correct a patient's hemodynamic status using intravenous esmolol.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous phenylephrine.
Your objective is to correct a patient's hemodynamic status using intravenous phenylephrine.
Can you select the appropriate drug and dose to correct a cardiovascular alteration?
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous atropine.
Your objective is to correct a patient's hemodynamic status using intravenous atropine.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous glycopyrrolate.
Your objective is to understand the effects of intravenous glycopyrrolate on the patient's cardiovascular status.
Use the skills learned in this module to correctly address bradycardia.
Learn about situations where manual ventilation might be needed.
Learn how to manually ventilate an intubated patient
Learn how to manually ventilate a patient using the mask.

cardTop: Manual Ventilation, the APL Valve, and the Flowmeters
description: Understand the relationship between the APL valve and the fresh gas flow rate during manual ventilation.
Can you properly manually ventilate a patient?
Learn about situations where manually-assisted ventilation might be appropriate.

cardTop: Manually-Assisted Ventilation of an Intubated Patient
description: Learn how to manually assist the ventilation of an intubated patient.
Learn how to manually assist the ventilation of a spontaneously breathing patient using a mask.
Can you increase the patient's minute ventilation through assisted ventilation?
Learn the basics of volume-controlled ventilation.

cardTop: Setting the Respiratory Rate and Tidal Volume
description: Learn how to set the respiratory rate and tidal volume for a mechanically ventilated patient.
Learn how to set the I:E ratio for a mechanically ventilated patient.
Learn how to set the PEEP for a mechanically ventilated patient.
Learn how to set the initial parameters for a mechanically-ventilated patient.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous propofol.
Utilize lidocaine to reduce the pain on injection associated with propofol.
Utilize propofol to perform an intravenous induction.
Utilize propofol to perform an intravenous induction.
Identify respiratory effects of propofol administration.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous etomidate.
Identify the cardiovascular effects of etomidate administration.
Identify the respiratory effects of etomidate administration.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous midazolam for preoperative sedation.
Identify the anxiolytic effects of midazolam administration.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous ketamine induction.
Identify the neurological effects of ketamine administration.
Identify the neurological effects of ketamine administration.
Identify the respiratory effects of ketamine administration.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous morphine.

cardTop: Analgesic and Systemic Effects of Morphine
description: Identify the analgesic and systemic effects of morphine administration.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous fentanyl.

cardTop: Analgesic and Systemic Effects of Fentanyl
description: Identify the analgesic and systemic effects of fentanyl administration.
Identify the indications, mechanism of action, and appropriate dosing regimen for intravenous sufentanil.

cardTop: Analgesic and Systemic Effects of Sufentanil
description: Identify the analgesic and systemic effects of sufentanil administration.

cardTop: Introduction to the Peripheral Nerve Stimulator
description: Learn the four types of tests available in the SIMVANA Peripheral nerve stimulator.
Learn how to connect the peripheral nerve stimulator to the two monitoring sites available in SIMVANA.
Learn how to perform the single twitch test using the peripheral nerve stimulator.
Learn how to perform the train of four test using the peripheral nerve stimulator.
Learn how to perform the double burst stimulation test using the peripheral nerve stimulator.
Learn how to perform the tetanic stimulation test using the peripheral nerve stimulator.
Learn the two different classes of neuromuscular blocking agents, their uses, and when to never use them.
Learn about the characteristics of a depolarizing neuromuscular blockade and the only agent that produces it.
Learn the appropriate dose, onset time, and duration of succinylcholine as well as its effect on a train-of-four test.
Learn the special considerations that must be contemplated when administering succinylcholine.
Learn the characteristics of nondepolarizing blocking agents, their dose, and the effect of rocuronium on the train of four.
Learn the significance of defasciculation and myalgia when administering depolarizing neuromuscular blocking agents
Learn about the two drugs commonly used to reverse nondepolarizing neuromuscular blockade.
Learn the appropriate method of reversing nondepolarizing neuromuscular blockade using an anticholinesterase agent.
Learn how to perform an intravenous induction and secure the airway with an endotracheal tube (ETT).
Learn how to perform an intravenous induction and secure the airway with a supraglottic airway device.
